page.title: 14Colne Valley Museum
page.content: The Colne Valley Museum is a working museum set in a group of weavers cottages.It is based on Victorian times and is open to the public at weekends. Many schools use the museum during the week. The children who go take part in things like spinning and weaving, baking and washing as in Victorian times. They also dress in Victorian costume. Twice a year the Colne Valley Museum holds a craft weekend at which the museum's craftsmen and visiting craftsmen show their skills in weaving, shoemaking and other crafts. The Colne Valley Museum is open from 2.00pm to 5.00pm on Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays and at other times by arrangement. The museum is set in the village of Golcar.
